publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-527 Cathy Jamieson: National Police Memorial Day 2007—That the Parliament notes the service for National Police Memorial Day to be held in Edinburgh on Sunday 30 September 2007; remembers the nearly 4,000 police officers who have been killed or died on duty and whose names are recorded on the police Roll of Honour; reminds the relatives, friends and colleagues of fallen officers that their sacrifice is not forgotten, and recognises the dedication to duty and courage displayed by police officers throughout Scotland and the United Kingdom on a daily basis as they go about their duty to protect the public.

S3M-527 Cathy Jamieson: National Police Memorial Day 2007—That the Parliament notes the service for National Police Memorial Day to be held in Edinburgh on Sunday 30 September 2007; remembers the nearly 4,000 police officers who have been killed or died on duty and whose names are recorded on the police Roll of Honour; reminds the relatives, friends and colleagues of fallen officers that their sacrifice is not forgotten, and recognises the dedication to duty and courage displayed by police officers throughout Scotland and the United Kingdom on a daily basis as they go about their duty to protect the public. Supported by: Ken Macintosh*, Robin Harper*, Karen Whitefield*, Margaret Smith*, Andy Kerr*, Sarah Boyack*, Elaine Smith*, Stuart McMillan*, Des McNulty*, Mike Pringle*, Alasdair Allan*, Elaine Murray*, Trish Godman*, Derek Brownlee*, Liam McArthur*, Murdo Fraser*, George Foulkes*, Hugh Henry*, Elizabeth Smith*, John Lamont*, Ian McKee*, Joe FitzPatrick*, Kenneth Gibson*, Jackie Baillie*, Patricia Ferguson*, Marilyn Livingstone*, John Park*, Bill Butler*, Mary Mulligan*
S3M-527 National Police Memorial Day 2007 (lodged on 20 September 2007) Pauline McNeill*, Bill Wilson*, Angela Constance*, Iain Gray*
